entities.name: karkaroff
entities.description: Karkaroff is a person who spat onto the ground at Dumbledore's feet. He is being physically restrained by Hagrid.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a person who seized Karkaroff's furs and lifted him into the air, slamming him against a nearby tree. He is being ordered by Dumbledore to escort Harry back up to the castle.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person who shouted at Hagrid to stop, and then orders him to take Harry back to school. He has authority over Hagrid.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person who needs to be escorted back up to the castle by Hagrid, as per Dumbledore's order.

relationships.description: Hagrid is physically restraining Karkaroff against a tree, as described in the text: 'Hagrid’s massive fist at his throat, his feet dangling in midair'.
Dumbledore is ordering Hagrid to take Harry back up to the castle, as described in the text: 'Kindly escort Harry back up to the castle, Hagrid,' said Dumbledore sharply.

Hagrid is restraining Karkaroff against a tree, as described in the text: 'In one swift movement, Hagrid seized the front of Karkaroff’s furs, lifted him into the air, and slammed him against a nearby tree'.
Hagrid is being ordered by Dumbledore to escort Harry back up to the castle, as described in the text: 'Kindly escort Harry back up to the castle, Hagrid,' said Dumbledore sharply.
